ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Japanese 157 is a good way to help you keep up with your Kanji skills as well as learn a few new grammar patterns. But this class is not nearly as fun and beneficial as the lower level Japanese classes.
yes. it's a class that you'd want to take.

I would summarize Japanese 157 as a course that quickly raises a student's Japanese skills, especially in Kanji and reading. I would definitely recommend the course as the course really helped me improve my Japanese and created a Japanese family at Yale.

To do your reading and preparation well takes a LOT of time put into it. Class meets three days a week but it wasn't unusual for me to spend 4-5 hours in preparation for each class.Even when the material is challenging, Murata and Seto put a lot of effort into their students and the materials they teach. They're pretty accommodating and chill when something comes up and a student needs leeway. I got the impression that while it seems they grade harshly (the number of red marks I got on each test was kinda depressing) they know when you're really putting in the effort and the final scores come out leniently to reflect that. The only reading i didn't like as much was "Igirisu ha oishii". Otherwise, there's a good mix of essays, articles, movies, songs, and a legit short story by the end.My reading and writing ability went up enormously after this class. Huge amounts of kanji (up to 15 or so a day) with occasional review tests are tough, but necessary. All my friends were impressed when I told them I was writing a term paper in Japanese for the final paper.Only real gripe is that the class size, especially afternoon section, was a little large, making it difficult to have as much speech practice in class. Definitely try to supplement class time with weekly Japanese table.
